page.title: 04FARMING AROUND INCE BLUNDELL
page.content: This is an area of mixed farming.At the time of our survey,May-June, Barley,Wheat and Oats were ripening in the fields.The potato crops were well -established but the sugar beet was still at a early stage of growth.The feilds given over to grass were almost ready for mowing after which the cattle would be allowed graze. Vegetables such as cauliflowers, carrots, sprouts and peas were also growing. Farming methods were modern and highly mechanised. The cattle are kept for beef and are mainly Charolais, Freisians and crosses. we surveyed six farms which covered about 75% of the area.We found that, of the 62 fields surveyed, 61% were in either potatoes or barley
